thread.title: Frank Miller shares more details on The Dark Knight Returns sequel at New York Comic Con - Comics
thread.title_full: Frank Miller shares more details on The Dark Knight Returns sequel at New York Comic Con - Comics News - Digital Spy

author: Tasha Hegarty
title: Frank Miller shares more details on The Dark Knight Returns sequel at New York Comic Con - Comics
text: Frank Miller has unveiled some teasers for his upcoming The Dark Knight Returns sequel while at New York Comic Con.Miller joined DC Comics artists Jim Lee, Klaus Janson, Andy Kubert and writer Brian Azzarello on the main stage to show off The Dark Knight III: The Master Race. Â© DC Comics During the event, Miller revealed that he "couldn't be more thrilled" with his writing team for their work on the new series, which follows on from the 2001 comic The Dark Knight Strikes Again.Each issue of The Dark Knight III: The Master Race will also come with a second comic book that tells the parallel story of various DC characters, with The Atom taking centre stage for the first part.Speaking of the endurance of the Batman character at the event, Miller compared the superhero to a diamond, saying he "won't break"."Batman is wonderfully malleable," he added. "You can throw him into any situation and you can't hurt him."The Dark Knight Returns sequel was announced last year with co-writer Miller drawing the covers and some interior artwork for the eight-issue miniseries. The first issue of The Dark Knight III: The Master Race will be released on November 25 and will feature both standard and variant covers.
